title: London & Modernity: ca 1880 to the Present
yc_attrs: This course can be applied towards the Humanities and Arts Yale College distributional requirement.
description:
This course explores modernity in relation to the changing character of London as a metropolitan and imperial center from the late 19th century to the present day. "Modernity" is a highly contested term. In this course it is used to denote both the attempts to modernize the city itself, as well as its inhabitants' experiences of the ambiguities of life in the biggest city the world has ever known. How London coped (or failed to cope) with the social and environmental problems created by its enormous size is one of the early questions explored in the course. Other key themes are: the local and the global, sexual scandal, popular entertainment, consumer culture, the experience of war, and the development of a multi-racial society. The fashion, food and popular music of London emerge as important components of the city's global identity in the 20th century. Students will come to see today's London as a complex product of development and destruction, viewing it more as historians than mere tourists.
